story.description: Reimagine your choices with the story of a professional in their struggle to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

content.dialogue:
You hear your phone ringing in the morning.
You pick up the phone and notice that it’s your colleague Sumit.
Hello
Hey! Good morning, I hope I didn’t wake you.
No, It’s okay.
Listen, my car broke down,so I’ll be needing a ride to work.
Could you please pick me up on your way to the office?
What would you rather think?
choices: I Feel uneasy about having company for the time I usually like spending by myself.
I Look forward to having a friend accompany me.

content.dialogue: Sure! I will pick you up in an hour. Is that okay?
Yes sure, meet you then.
You hang you and notice that your partner, Smitha has walked in...
It’s a big day today, huh?
Yeah, it’s a really big project,I wonder if I will get it.
Given a choice which project will you pick?
What would you choose?
choices: The one that fits best after weighing in the different aspects.
The one that feels right to me.

content.dialogue: What if Sumit gets it instead of you?
what will you say?
choices: Well, that would be unfair, I’m sure I did a better job than he did.
My boss is fair, maybe his work really was better than mine then.

content.dialogue: Hmmm… anyway, don’t worry, I’m sure it’ll all go well.
what will you say?
choices: Yeah, I think I’ve done a good job. I deserve it.
Well, everyone seems to have done a better job than me… let’s see what happens.

content.dialogue: I’ll keep my fingers crossed! Bye! Take care.
You bid Smitha goodbye and pick Sumit on your way to office.
I have never lied in my life:
choices: True
False

content.dialogue: Hey, did you talk to the client about the deadlines?
I haven't, I believe the team can do it.
I made a commitment to the client about finishing the project by the end of this month.
With the current workload, and the project requirements you’re mentioning, it will be difficult.
I think I’ll ask them all to clock in extra hours.
You disagree with his approach.
What would you rather think?
choices: I should Voice my point of view, I believe you have a valid argument.
I should Say nothing/ agree with him, I’m unsure of my judgement.

content.dialogue: You reach office and walk in towards your desk.
Hey will you be joining in for the meeting today?
I still have a little work leftover from yesterday; I’ll join in if i can get it done.
Who is addressing the meeting today?
Sachin, Our manager!
I’ll try to come in, but I am really worried about today.
I am surprised you have managed to stay head strong through all the work load.
I just live by the motto:
choices: Stop and smell the roses!
Early bird gets the worm!

content.dialogue: That seems nice, I’ll try living by it too. See you soon. Bye
I have climbed mount Everest more than once:
choices: True
False

content.dialogue:
You settle in at your desk and 
start working on an important memo when a colleague walks in.
Hey! I needed your opinion on this new project I’m working on.
Do you think we should do some focus group sessions for the product?
Hmm… that’s an interesting idea, what demographics are you targeting?
Distracted by what he’s saying, you close the window without remembering to save your work.
What do you think?
choices: I’m so angry at him for distracting me.
I feel so angry with myself for being careless.

content.dialogue: You finish writing the memo and go in for the meeting.
Good morning, I hope you all read the email I sent in this morning briefing you all on the upcoming project, it is extremely important to us.
Sachin in the meeting declares that one team will be lead by you and the other by sourabh, Sachin asks you to pick the project you would like to lead.
Which project would you rather choose?
choices: The project that requires you to work with facts and figures.
The project which gives you creative freedom.

content.dialogue: I would rather work on project Walmart.
You made this decision:
choices: With my head.
With my heart

content.dialogue: I have never stolen anything in my life:
choices: True
False

content.dialogue: After the meeting ends you go back to your desk and realize that now you have a lot of work to do.
Would you rather?
choices: Make a time table, plan, and organise my day, taking into account my new tasks.
Carve out time during the day, when I can, to work on the new project.

content.dialogue: You then decide to:
choices: Finish one task before moving to the next one.
Start tasks simultaneously, all at different stages of completion.

content.dialogue:
You call a meeting to discuss the POA with your team,
two of your teammates say they won’t be able to make it to the meeting, at the last moment.
What will be your reaction?
choices: Hold onto a grudge against them for ruining an agreed upon plan.
Be angry momentarily but get over it soon.

content.dialogue: You walk in to see Sumit talking to a colleague.
Hey!
Hey,This is Sourabh.He will be leading our project. He is ...
How would you like Sumit to describe you?
choices: Hard to get to know.
Easy to get to know.

content.dialogue:
I have heard a lot about you from sumit.
 I am eager to know what it would be like working with you.
I can’t wait to work with you as well, however,
at work I tend to be:
choices: Flexible and Carefree.
Controlling and Governing.

content.dialogue: In that case we will work well together.
Thats great, I think we should start the meeting now.
Yes, All the best!

Hello everyone! So, I’ve emailed you all a brief layout of the project.
 I want all of you to work on a proposal laying out your suggestions and POAs.
 Send it to me by the end of the day, and we shall proceed from thereon.
I’ll be looking for:
choices: The big picture- the details can be refined later.
The details and logistics- to ensure the project runs smoothly

content.dialogue:
With the mail I have also attached a pdf that highlights the hurdles we might face as we move forward.
 I would like you all to come up with a few solutions to solve them.
Are you?
choices: Willing to try out new ideas and solutions.
Prefer making use of strategies which have been known to work in the past

content.dialogue:
The meeting goes according to plan and you decide to conduct a brainstorming session
ow would you prefer to conduct this session.
What will you prefer?
choices: Or by having teams talk privately between themselves
By addressing everyone directly through a speech

content.dialogue:
Since we are starting a new project. It is important that we get to know each other.
 We will therefore go for a team dinner which will help us.
 So help me decide a venue for tonight.
How about we go to Mayfair?

(Everyone agrees)
You don’t like Mayfair.
You think:
choices: I should ask them to change the venue.
I should go along with the plan to make sure that the outing goes along smoothly.

content.dialogue: When you are out for the team dinner you are more likely to?
choices: Just go with the flow.
Be particular about what you will do and when.

content.dialogue: I have been suffering from a very rare form of disorder for a while:
choices: True
False

content.dialogue: The dinner goes well and you reach home.
Your partner opens the door, and you excitedly tell them about your day.
Oh my God! This is amazing! You deserve it, I’m so proud of you!
I’m so happy! I’m in the mood to cook today, why don’t I make dinner?
That sounds wonderful! So what’s on the menu?
Well, that’s a surprise! I am now going to...
choices: Find a tried and tested recipe, and follow along as directed.
Decide to experiment, and see what I can come up with.

content.dialogue: Well, I hope It’s something I like… What if it doesn’t turn out well?
Well, I will be:
choices: Determined to retry with a different method.
I would be disheartened and won’t retry.

content.dialogue: I am sure it will be great!
After dinner you go sit in your bedroom and you start going over the meeting in your head.
You think:
choices: I feel like I handled myself well, and channelised the meeting appropriately
My behaviour was unsatisfactory. I don’t know if others considered me worthy enough of being a ‘team leader’

content.dialogue: Smitha walks in
Hey, what you think about?
About today’s meeting. I don't know how I feel about being promoted or about how I conducted today's meeting.
Do you think that most of your colleagues would have been better team leaders than you?
You:
choices: Disgaree!
Agree!

content.dialogue: I am sure you will do a great job.
I hope so too.
Are you going to work right now?
Yes, I need to evaluate reports everyone sent in.
What types of reports do you prefer?
I prefer reports which are written:
choices: Elaborately, describing important ideas in as much detail as required.
Concisely, crisp and to-the-point.

content.dialogue: That’s interesting! How are you while providing feedback to your team-members on the proposal they present?
I tend to be:
choices: Romantic and Optimistic.
Organized and Realistic.

content.dialogue:
After incorporating your insights where appropriate, you email the chosen proposal to your boss.
This is your first submission as team leader.Hoping to hear from your supervisor the next day,
 you turn in for the night.
I have never been sick:
choices: Yes
No

content.dialogue: Hey, Sachin has asked you to meet him in his cabin. Did you take a look at the proposal I sent?

Yes. I made a few changes and sent it to Sachin yesterday.
 I think he wants to talk to me about the  proposal. I’ll go meet him immediately.
Protagonist meets Sachin in the cabin
Sumit said that you wanted to meet me.
Yes, I just read the proposal you drafted, please have a seat.
Yes.

This is not what i was looking for, I expected much more from you.
 Now I will have to email you a proposal drafted by my team for a previous project. Please go through it. Completely re-draft the proposal and send it to me by the end of the week
You tend to:
choices: Accept the criticism, and rework the proposal according to the suggestions.
Defend my work, and let it be the way it is.

content.dialogue:
From this encounter, you learn that you will have to regroup with your team 
 as you realise that the work they’ve been doing is not upto the mark based on your expectations.
You call for a meeting with the team and tend to:
choices: Criticize them and tell them to rework the proposal
explain your expectations and ask them to rework it

content.dialogue: Moving on from Sachin’s office, you are struggling to balance numerous files at once, someone bumps into you, causing everything to fall.
You will:
choices: Get angry and shout at the person!
Be annoyed but understand that it was an accident.

content.dialogue: This had been a difficult day, and you feel quite low at the end of it.
You think:
choices: I should spend a quiet night at home, unwinding by myself.
I should spend some quality time with my friends and/or family to forget about the stress at work

content.dialogue: When you reach home, your partner begins complaining about an electricity bill you forgot to pay.

You forgot to pay the electricity bill.Now we have to pay the late fee.
 How can you be so absent minded? I’ve been reminding you about the bill for a week.
You:
choices: You feel irritated and snap at your wife
You feel irritated,but dont show it.

content.dialogue: When you turn in for the night, you can’t help but think that asking Sumit to draft the proposal was a bad idea- he hasn’t had any experience in this area whatsoever, and his inexperience has cost you a lot of valuable time.
You:
choices: Would regret the risk but try to do better next time.
Blame yourself and shy away from similar future investments.

content.dialogue: You realize that reworking the proposal is going to be time consuming and that you have taken on more responsibility than you would be able to complete within the said deadline.
You:
choices: You decide to learn from your mistake, but continue the project as planned for now.
Decide to delegate more work from now to avoid overburdening yourself.

content.dialogue: You think it’ll help to discuss your dilemma with a friend.
You decide to call:
choices: A practical person with a solution based on good and thorough judgment.
A person with quick and brilliant solutions.

content.dialogue: I hope you haven't forgotten that we need to go to my uncle’s 75th birthday celebration. We need to leave in an hour please get ready.
But I’d decided to stay home and get some work done tonight.
We talked about this 2 weeks ago.
You want to:
choices: Cancel your plans to accompany Smitha.
Decline her invitation, and continue with your plan.

content.dialogue: You have to come. I’ve already told them you would. We can come home early if you want, but you have to come.
Fine. I’ll go get changed.
You pick an outfit for the evening. But Smitha doesn’t seem to like it.
You:
choices: Go get changed, because you’re not entirely happy with it anymore
Wear it anyway since you like how it looks on you.

content.dialogue: During  the party!
You are:
choices: The quiet  one who  enjoys their own company.
The life of the party, and mingle with new people easily.

content.dialogue: You see Smitha’s cousins standing in a corner. You go in and greet them.
Hey.
Hey, nice to see you could come. How’s everything going?
Really well, What were you guys talking about?
The movie that just came out. Did you see it?
Yes I did.
Isn’t it absolutely amazing we all loved it!
You did not like the movie at all.
You:
choices: Mimic their feelings and opinions for the sake of the conversation.
Discuss your feelings and opinions with them.

content.dialogue:
While you’re talking to her cousins, Smitha walks up behind you and tells you that her aunt is looking for you.
 The last time you met this aunt, you both had a really unpleasant experience. But now it seems as though she’s making an effort to reconnect.
You:
choices: Accept because you value logic.
Decline because you value sentiment.

content.dialogue: A bunch of people at the party ask you to say a few words about Smitha’s uncle. You’re not prepared for this.
You:
choices: Quickly jot down a few points and do the needful.
Politely refuse as you’re not prepared

content.dialogue: Before leaving you go to greet your cousins goodbye, you hear them discussing about how great the food. You disagree with their opinion.
Would you rather:
choices: I will just nod and listen to the conversation.
I will state that I disagree with them.

content.dialogue: Post the party, you drive home and sit on you bed. You are tired and exhausted. You enter into deep thought about your work-life balance and how stressed you are.
You speak with smitha about learning better ways of dealing with your work demands and further working towards your wellness. Both of you come to a conclusion that you should give therapy a try.
